issue.message: Call requires permission which may be rejected by user: code should explicitly check to see if permission is available (with `checkPermission`) or explicitly handle a potential `SecurityException`
Call requires permission which may be rejected by user: code should explicitly check to see if permission is available (with `checkPermission`) or explicitly handle a potential `SecurityException`

`commons-logging` defines classes that conflict with classes now provided by Android. Solutions include finding newer versions or alternative libraries that don't have the same problem (for example, for `httpclient` use `HttpUrlConnection` or `okhttp` instead), or repackaging the library using something like `jarjar`.

`httpclient` defines classes that conflict with classes now provided by Android. Solutions include finding newer versions or alternative libraries that don't have the same problem (for example, for `httpclient` use `HttpUrlConnection` or `okhttp` instead), or repackaging the library using something like `jarjar`.
By convention, the custom view (`TextViewCustom`) and the declare-styleable (`textViewCustom`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)
Suspicious indentation: This is conditionally executed; expected it to be indented
Replace the <fragment> tag with FragmentContainerView.
Replace the <fragment> tag with FragmentContainerView.
Replace the <fragment> tag with FragmentContainerView.
Replace the <fragment> tag with FragmentContainerView.
Consider adding a `<queries>` declaration to your manifest when calling this \ method; see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details
Consider adding a `<queries>` declaration to your manifest when calling this \ method; see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details
Consider adding a `<queries>` declaration to your manifest when calling this \ method; see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details
Consider adding a `<queries>` declaration to your manifest when calling this \ method; see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details
Should use "`sp`" instead of "`dp`" for text sizes
Should use "`sp`" instead of "`dp`" for text sizes
Should use "`sp`" instead of "`dp`" for text sizes

Use of this function is discouraged because resource reflection makes it harder to perform build optimizations and compile-time verification of code. It is much more efficient to retrieve resources by identifier (e.g. `R.foo.bar`) than by name (e.g. `getIdentifier("bar", "foo", null)`).
Formatting %d followed by words ("messages"): This should probably be a plural rather than a string
Reading app signatures from `getPackageInfo`: The app signatures could be exploited if not validated properly; see issue explanation for details
Using `getLine1Number` to get device identifiers is not recommended
Using `getSimSerialNumber` to get device identifiers is not recommended
Using `setJavaScriptEnabled` can introduce XSS vulnerabilities into your application, review carefully
Using `setJavaScriptEnabled` can introduce XSS vulnerabilities into your application, review carefully
Insecure Base Configuration
Missing `PendingIntent` mutability flag

This folder configuration (`v24`) is unnecessary; `minSdkVersion` is 31. Merge all the resources in this folder into `drawable`.
Do not place Android context classes in static fields; this is a memory leak
Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `DetailLayoutBinding` which has field `topBar` pointing to `RelativeLayout`); this is a memory leak
Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `LinkAreaLayoutBinding` which has field `labelWebviewDriveW3b` pointing to `TextView`); this is a memory leak
Unconditional layout inflation from view adapter: Should use View Holder pattern (use recycled view passed into this method as the second parameter) for smoother scrolling
This `Handler` class should be static or leaks might occur (it.giovanni.arkivio.fragments.detail.youtube.videowall.VideoWallActivity.FlipDelayHandler)
